intro: Illigera vespertilio, commonly known as the evening bat plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to parts of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color, which are adapted for pollination by insects. It is characterized by its succulent leaves and stems, which help it conserve water in arid environments. The plant is also noted for its unique seed structure, which includes a specialized appendage that aids in dispersal.
